About the App

The C A Wildfire App is designed to track and avoid active wildfires in 2018, filter and find historic wildfires and prescribed burns and learn more about wildfires in the State of California. Different datasets may be turned on or off using the layers function at the top right of the app. Customize your experience and explore the app in-depth using the widgets located underneath the search toolbar. The basic function of each widget is explained below.

 

About the Widgets

Bookmark - Add bookmarks of your important locations (for example your home or your family members' homes), or view existing bookmarks for recent wildfire events.

Near Me - Enter an address and see how far away the nearest active fire perimeter is and where your nearest evacuation centres are. Also get directions to the nearest evacuation centres. Increase the buffer distance if there are no evacuation centres in your immediate area.

Charts - Use the spatial extent of the map or create a shape around a region of interest to get a visual of wildfire area in acres based on the Historic Wildfires layer, Historic Prescribed Burns layer and Active Wildfires in 2018 layer.

Swipe - Go to the layers list and turn on the layers you are interested in. Turn on the swipe widget. By clicking on more than one layer in the layers list, a drop down menu will let you choose which areas you want seen in the magnifying glass.

Share - Get a shareable link to this app to send to your friends and family. Findings and information you discover in the app may be shared through Facebook and Twitter as well.


Please Note: When using the Wildland Fire Potential layer click on the map to see a description of what each colour represents.

 

Reminder

For all using the C A Wildfire App as a tool to evacuate a wildfire zone, please remember to follow local wildfire protocol set by authority. Our prayers go out to all of those effected by the 2018 wildfires in the State of California.
